TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 9: 'She Wants Revenge'

Lauren McNeilage weighs on the latest episode of AHS: Hotel, which is a chaotic but enjoyable romp

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 8: 'The Ten Commandments Killer'

Lauren McNeilage takes a look at the latest episode where we are finally given the identity of the Ten Commandments Killer... (it's exactly who everybody thought it would be)

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 8: 'Start to Finish'

This mid-series finale is not the best one in the show's history but it does have some exciting moments, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 7: 'Heads Up'

This week sees the much anticipated reveal of a series regular's fate and the continuation of conflict inside the walls of Alexandria, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 1: 'Laws of Nature'

Thomas Ron hopes that Agent of Shield's third season can stay on the right track and not return to its season one issues

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 6: 'Always Accountable'

After a two week slump, The Walking Dead is back on top form, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 7: 'Flicker'

With movie-star threesomes, Old-Hollywood flashbacks, and a semi-interesting John Lowe storyline, 'Flicker' is a lot of fun - and yet it feels like too little, too late says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 9: 'Sleep No More'

Sometimes when Doctor Who releases an experimental episode it is one of the best things on television, but unfortunately that isn't the case with this week's episode, says Niall Whitehead

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 6: 'Room 33'

Despite a couple of interesting twists, 'Room 33' makes it painfully clear that this season has no plot, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 5: 'Now'

A sub-par filler episode of The Walking Dead leaves a lot to be desired. Liam Dooley reviews

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 6: 'What Lies Tangled' Part Two

Lewis and Hathaway take their final bow and thus end the story of the man who has been described as the nicest copper on TV. Katy Sandalls reviews.

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 5: 'Room Service'

Liz Taylor finally gets a backstory, and John Lowe continues to be the least interesting thing about this season, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 4: 'Here's Not Here'

Some much needed light is shed on what happened during Morgan's hiatus from the show, but it comes at an inopportune moment in the series, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 5: 'What Lies Tangled' Part One

Lewis and Hathaway's last ever murder case is not only a thoroughly explosive ordeal, but is also highly realistic, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 4: 'Magnum Opus' Part Two

A surprisingly poor episode of Lewis fails to live up to the quality promised by its title, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 4: 'Devil's Night'

Lauren McNeilage weighs on the latest episode as serial killer James March holds a dinner party from hell in a truly terrifying episode

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 3: 'Thank You'

The fate of one of The Walking Dead's oldest cast members hangs in the balance as the group tries to divert the walkers away from Alexandria. Liam Dooley reviews.

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 3: 'Mommy'

Angela Bassett brings some much needed life to an otherwise gloomy episode of American Horror Story, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 3: 'Magnum Opus' Part One

Some predictable moments and plot points that seem very similar make this episode of Lewis feel somewhat disappointing, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 2: 'JSS'

The Wolves are in the walls and Alexandria is in for its first encounter with the chaotic outside world. Liam Dooley reviews

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 5: 'The Girl Who Died'

With a story-line that is not too complex, this episode about Vikings is a refreshing change to the usual style of Doctor Who, says Ida Sjoberg

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 2: 'One for Sorrow' Part Two

An unpredictable plot and a compelling side story allowed for a thoroughly entertaining episode of Lewis, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: Homeland - Series Five Episode One: 'Separation Anxiety'

By James Bithell

Jack Alden reviews the season premiere of Homeland as it attempts to reinvent itself, yet again, at the start of its fifth season, like its protagonist Carrie Mathison

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 2: 'Chutes and Ladders'

Despite a chilling turn by Evan Peters, this season is still frustratingly lacking in scares, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: The Walking Dead Series 6 Episode 1: 'First Time Again'

The Walking Dead returns with a zombie-filled, action-packed and visually stunning first episode, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 4: 'Before the Flood'

Despite a few questionable moments, the fourth episode of this series is a thrilling introduction to the show for new viewers, says Niall Whitehead

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 1: 'One for Sorrow' Part One

This week, Lewis returned for its final series (for the third time) and it was brilliant as ever, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 3: 'Under the Lake'

The Timelord moved onto his second two-parter of the series this week with Under the Lake. Katy Sandalls reviews

TV Review: Fear the Walking Dead - Series 1 Episode 6: 'The Good Man'

The series finale of Fear the Walking Dead is a heart-pounding, action-packed and zombie-filled spectacle and is truly the show at its best, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 2: 'The Witch's Familiar'

Davros and the Doctor get some of their finest scenes in the thrilling second episode of Doctor Who's ninth (or thirty-fifth) series, says Rhys Thompson
